challenges.title: Active German Users
challenges.scenario: Your product team wants to target German users who are also active.
challenges.prompt: Get the names of users from Germany who are active.
challenges.expected_query: SELECT name FROM users WHERE country = 'Germany' AND is_active = TRUE;
reflection: What happens if you reverse the order of conditions?
hints: Use AND to combine both filters.

challenges.title: Trial or Free Users
challenges.scenario: You need a list of users who are either on a free plan or trial.
challenges.prompt: Select users who have plan 'free' OR 'trial'.
challenges.expected_query: SELECT user_id FROM users WHERE plan = 'free' OR plan = 'trial';
reflection: When would you use OR in real data filtering?
hints: Use separate conditions for each value.

challenges.title: Not USA Customers
challenges.scenario: Compliance needs to audit non-USA customers.
challenges.prompt: List customers not from the USA.
challenges.expected_query: SELECT customer_id FROM customers WHERE country != 'USA';

challenges.title: Logged In But Not Premium
challenges.scenario: Find users who are active but not on a premium plan.
challenges.prompt: Select user IDs where user is active AND not premium.
challenges.expected_query: SELECT user_id FROM users WHERE is_active = TRUE AND is_premium = FALSE;
reflection: How do we express negation in conditions?

challenges.title: Risk Accounts
challenges.scenario: Security needs accounts from outside EU OR marked as inactive.
challenges.prompt: List all risky accounts (region != 'EU' OR is_active = FALSE).
challenges.expected_query: SELECT account_id FROM accounts WHERE region != 'EU' OR is_active = FALSE;
reflection: How can OR increase result size?
hints: Make sure either condition qualifies the row.
